From: Sarah Date: 4/16/97 03:47 Subject: Thinking about New Jersey Hello my patient loyal troopsters. And now it's time for another in the continuing stooooory of a pig that's gone to the dogs. It's PIIIIIIIGGSS INNNNNNN SPAAAAAAAAAAAACE....... Or am I getting those two mixed up anymore? You know, you always wonder if those pigs in that chintzy spaceship ever believe they are going somewhere (even if it's not where no pig has gone before.) Do they think, "yes that star looks familiar - it hasn't changed for five whole episodes"? The reason I'm asking this is (yes, Virginia, there is ALWAYS a reason) I think we have to go through Chicago to check out the New Jersey school. (Or check into the New Jersey school. One or the other. ) Of course, I am saying "we" here pretty darned royally. I'm not sure if the school board will pay for me to accompany Laurel, or if they are just planning on buying her a ''one way ticket'' and letting the stewardesses thrash it out. Given the mood that all of us have been in lately, that may well be the plan. Why am I writing this nonsense to you all at 3 am in the morning? Because I just woke up from a dream I can't even remember and tried to think of something - anything positive. Laurel is up too, throwing her sister's teddy bear out of the window, running out the door, picking it up, bringing it back inside, and throwing it again. I should stop here. Any sane mother would, but I keep thinking that maybe if Laurel hears the computer going she will want to type too. . . that does seem ''to calm her a bit''. Hey, I just suddenly remembered the concourse between A and B at the Chicago O'Hare Airport. I went through about 10 years ago - just a bit ''BC*''. It's some sort of modern art: The Subject: a dark tunnel with fluted stained glass walls, a mirrored ceiling, and bright neon tubes near the ceiling that range the rainbow - from pale yellow to bright magenta and back again. It's something Laurel would have just loved (Or may still love - I'll get us a long layover...) --higher --lower ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''one way ticket'' Does this terrify me only -> (link-goto: "Frozen dreams") because I know what will -> (link-goto: "alone.") happen when I leave her? -> (link-goto: "Death fear") ''to calm her a bit '' If I had a bridge to -> (link-goto: "Laurel's World") the outside world, -> (link-goto: "Hands on talking") it would calm me, too. -> (link-goto: "Broken wires") ''BC*'' -> (link-goto: "BC") ''--higher'' -> (link-goto: "On an orphan train") ''--lower '' People monsters -> (link-goto: "trip") Is there anything -> (link-goto: "I am not") more to life than -> (link-goto: "entirely sure") false memories -> (link-goto: "this is how") or incoherent -> (link-goto: "it happened") dreams? -> (link-goto: "Or if it did.") ''--higher'' -> (link-goto: "Chicago") ''--lower'' -> (link-goto: "GLASS HARMONICA") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")To: Sarah Murphy From: Sarah Subject: Memory files DateLine: Fall 1984 If the moon took my child, it certainly would not be in the middle of Chicago O'Hare Airport. There would be far too many witnesses. Chicago is relatively sane, unlike - say - New York City. If it were La Guardia Airport, no one would see anything. In Chicago, surely someone would go ahead and say "Yeah, I saw the moon swoop down through the tunnel and snatch that lady's kid. Right, the moon had long neon colored hair and was wearing a milky white gown with green stripes. About 6 foot 4, maybe 140-150 pounds or so. Skinny bitch, the moon." Or at the very least, notify the ''proper authorities''. And the moon would never bother the concourses again. --higher --elsewhere --back --lower ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''proper authorities'' Who would, no doubt, -> (link-goto: "Reputations") take the appropriate -> (link-goto: "Social Services") actions. -> (link-goto: "Advocrazy") ''--higher'' -> (link-goto: "Chicago") ''--elsewhere '' radio waves -> (link-goto: "Night moves") Sarah -> (link-goto: "Steamed clams") cosmo-agony -> (link-goto: "HOLD NO HOPE") End points. -> (link-goto: "Egress") ''--back'' -> (link-goto: "it happened") ''--lower ''-> (link-goto: "trip") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")To: Sarah Murphy From: Sarah Subject: Memory files DateLine: Fall 1984 All I can remember from that tunnel between concourses is the slowly changing, every-flashing lines of neon, ''mirrored into infinity'' from the ceiling. I knew then that if the moon had ''hair'' it would be these neon strands, so infinitely reflected in the mirrored ceiling stained silver like the clouds basking in the moon's stolen light. If the moon ''had a voice'', then it would be these reed tones growing into the music flowing far from the light. --Higher --Further --Back --Lower ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''mirrored into infinity'' Mirrors only reflect -> (link-goto: "Loose wire") our own madness. -> (link-goto: "SOLE REMEDY") ''hair'' The moon weaves her hair -> (link-goto: "Doubletake") from ancient starlight. -> (link-goto: "hair") ''had a voice'' I know only that this -> (link-goto: "snow voice") is a voice I cannot -> (link-goto: "other moons") find or hear. -> (link-goto: "GLASS HARMONICA") ''--higher'' -> (link-goto: "Chicago") ''--further '' circling smoke -> (link-goto: "it happened") radio waves -> (link-goto: "Memories") ''--back ''-> (link-goto: "entirely sure") ''--lower'' -> (link-goto: "trip") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")To: Sarah Murphy From: Sarah Subject: Memory files DateLine: Fall 1984 This was a long time ago, but sometimes I just know it was only the day before yesterday. My friend (this could have been Leah, who used to keep the magic we forgot in a hidden corner on the school playground, or maybe it was Susan, who used to be Megalasourus, who was going to be a palentologist because she understood what it was to be frozen in stone) and I went off to Chicago because she had ''something to show me''. I'm not entirely sure when or what we were doing there other than that. --Higher --Further --Lower ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''something to show me'' What rights do memories -> (link-goto: "DOWN TO GRIEF") have to interfere -> (link-goto: "affair") with the now? -> (link-goto: "No harm done") ''--higher'' -> (link-goto: "Chicago") ''--further'' circling smoke -> (link-goto: "entirely sure") radio waves -> (link-goto: "Yesterday") ''--lower'' -> (link-goto: "trip") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")To: Sarah Murphy From: Sarah Subject: Memory files DateLine: Fall 1984 My friend's sight came in only through frazzled nerves, and the blurred effect, she swore, was the only way she could show me this. She needed me to see through her eyes. She needed someone to understand. So she lent me some weed and an old pair of glasses. Properly blurred, we turned into the tunnel between concourses B and C of Chicago's O'Hare Airport. There ought to be a warning posted: The light show you are about to see could cause ''orgasmic understanding''. Stay on the moving sidewalk. Do not look up or to the side. But this is what most people don't look around or experience anything anyway, so why bother? The first time through, the neon threads hanging below the ceiling threatened my eyes with their infinite possibilities. So I shaded my eyes and looked only at the fluted walls: the thick milky colors floating past. It probably took four trips and maybe ten more tokes before I could find the courage to stare at the ceiling, with its dragon-cache of mirrored neon rainbows. That's when I knew for sure. --Higher --Further --Back --Lower ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''orgasmic understanding'' Why can't anyone -> (link-goto: "AFTER A WHILE") describe what -> (link-goto: "LULLABY") an orgasm feels like? -> (link-goto: "my body is in charge") ''--higher'' -> (link-goto: "Chicago") ''--further'' radio waves -> (link-goto: "Rain-blowed") circling smoke -> (link-goto: "this is how") ''--back'' -> (link-goto: "I am not") ''--lower'' -> (link-goto: "trip") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")To: Sarah Murphy From: Sarah Subject: Memory files DateLine: Fall 1984 It did happen. I have the ticket stub somewhere, probably in with the self-generating bunny dust under the refrigerator. But what I'm wondering about now is whether it happened to me or to Laurel or to someone else entirely. If it had been Laurel, then all that stuff about weed wouldn't be necessary. If it had been anyone else, I'd have to tell you to do the Columbian gold, definitely with the seeds. Or else home grown, the kind you spray with sugar water just before you cut it. But would it happen again if I took Laurel to New Jersey? And ''what am I afraid of''? The idea that the concourse between A and B in Chicago O'Hare Airport is close enough to the moon that Laurel could be snatched up is ludicrous and just shows I haven't had enough sleep in way too long. --Higher --Further --Back --Lower ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''what am I afraid of'' There are more forms of -> (link-goto: "Can't say 2") madness in the world than -> (link-goto: "Out of options") we are willing to admit. -> (link-goto: "1-2 punch") ''--higher'' -> (link-goto: "Chicago") ''--further'' circling smoke -> (link-goto: "Or if it did.") radio waves -> (link-goto: "Don't stand") ''--back'' -> (link-goto: "this is how") ''--lower'' -> (link-goto: "trip") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")To: Sarah Murphy From: Sarah Subject: Memory files DateLine: Fall 1984 When all my troubles seemed not far away. ''--Further'' ->?? ''--Lower'' -> ?? ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")It is said that to play it is to go insane. Mozart, of course, could not resist and wrote a quintet for it. Oboe, viola, and cello flirting as always with luna and some extra bubbles for the flute. Glass moistened at the rim and spun in orbits of overtones. The timbre may be what invokes the moon so often. The oboe only makes one a bit strange, not ''totally possessed''. --moon --sarah ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''totally possessed'' The moon holds all our -> (link-goto: "SOLE REMEDY") souls in the tightness -> (link-goto: "Life sparks") of her fist. -> (link-goto: "DENIAL") ''--moon ''-> (link-goto: "HOLD NO HOPE") ''--sarah'' -> (link-goto: "Steamed clams") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")dTo: mmarconi@netcom.com, grahambell@aol.com, grever@ibr8smtp... From: Sarah Date: 5/30/96 22:39 Subject: School Board entertainment Ahh the early lazy days of summer vacation, when life is full of possibilities. You could be a spelunker and find a thousand caves filled with coins of gold (or at the very least pogs of skull and pirate faces). You could dive from heights unknown to man and land on neatly made beds. Hold it right there. I think the neatly made beds part is a ''mommy fantasy'', and one the kids would not appreciate. After all, who would WANT to be the mommy during summer vacation? Jack Cooper came by to play with Janet at a quarter of seven in the evening. It was still plenty light, so I said that they could go outside for a little bit. Laurel toddled along behind them, wanting to be in on the fun. I pulled on some shoes and followed all of them out, with my hair unbrushed and no bra. Laurel immediately took off for the school, and Janet and Jack followed her. Which would have been fine, except that there was an open school board meeting going on, and the doors were unlocked. Jack, curious, threw the door open and in Laurel went, to her old room. She played on the computer, and that would have been fine, except that she decided she needed to go through the window. This, too, would have been fine, except that someone had been revarnishing the window and it would not open all the way. So she was stuck half way through. I spent a good deal of time waiting for her to back out. Laurel refused to move. Finally, I pulled her away from the outside and Janet closed the window. Unable to get back out the window, Laurel pinched me, then knocked my glasses flying along with a handful of my hair. She grabbed a double handful of hair and pulled me to the ground, while she turned onto her back, still holding my hair, and kicked me in the face and stomach. I had to cover her mouth and nose to get her to let go. After she got up, she continued screaming, and wouldn't the school meeting happen to be getting out just then. You should have seen the looks I got from the other mothers. I'm going to hear about the ''looks*'' later. On the way home, Janet periodically lunged for my breasts, pinching them viciously. Boy, that's effective. I jumped around her and walked on ahead, and she followed. She was pretty much calm by the time we got home. I made her go to her room anyway. She was mad, and screamed and beat on the doors. Her hands were tattered shreds of skin by the time she was calm enough for me to go in. I don't think the Anafranil is working. Her ''OCD*'' has escalated since she's been on it, and her aggression increased this past week. The psychiatrist ''raised her dosage''. But I just don't think that's it. I don't know what to do. The thing is, it's mostly these breaks in structure that precipitate the problem, so I don't think there would be such a problem in a highly structured environment. How do you explain the summer vacation? Especially when the last time she was out was the long "break" in the middle of last year as the school couldn't get its act together to save its ass. I try for a consistent home schedule. We attempt to wake up at the same time, do exercises at the same time, etc. But it is nowhere near what she can get in a school, with bells, other classes, and all the frenetic yet ordered activities. Face it, I can't guarantee a constant, consistent, highly structured environment outside of school. The boundaries are too vague to really set anything up. Further, the outside errands (grocery shopping, gas, etc.) are low structure, high random events. Going for a walk is a vague sort of thingÃ‘even if you do it at the same time each evening. And that's when most of the aggression is happening. I guess what I really want is to abolish summer vacations, weekends, and any other stray aberrations from the schedule. Feedback guys? --Higher --Lower ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''a mommy fantasy'' These are the sequels -> (link-goto: "Somehow") to the romances -> (link-goto: "Mama") that are never written. -> (link-goto: "LULLABY") ''looks*'' -> (link-goto: "the looks") ''OCD*'' -> (link-goto: "OCD") ''raised her dosage'' When I have a moment -> (link-goto: "Meds") remind me to ask why -> (link-goto: "Consultants") medication -> (link-goto: "drugs") and meditation -> (link-goto: "trip") are just one letter apart -> (link-goto: "Med-daze") ''--Higher'' -> (link-goto: "For poorer") ''--Lower'' -> (link-goto: "Broken wires") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")To: Sarah Murphy From: Sarah Subject: Psych files DateLine: Summer 1990 By her third birthday, Laurel had been screaming practically nonstop for ten months. Her vocabulary consisted of: Â¤ a high, keening note which meant ''she wanted something'': a bottle, a wheel from the Big Wheels toy car to spin, a clean diaper, a piece of moonlight on the wall. Something, anything. I was never sure what. Â¤ a dark, low scream that signified pure terror. I learned to recognize the symptoms and ''causes of fears'': the front door, a piece of paper, my hands, running water. Everything, anything became ''the enemy'' to be slain through her voice. Â¤ a ceaseless scale of sound like an operatic banshee that went from a low moan to an inaudibly high squeal. This was ''the ultimate air raid'' that kept everything else at bay and was used whenever the other two were not enough to ''convey her soul''. --Higher --Further --Lower ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''she wanted something'' Hush little baby -> (link-goto: "doors") don't say a word. -> (link-goto: "fillgree") Momma's gonna buy -> (link-goto: "THE MOON'S PRICE") you a mocking bird. -> (link-goto: "Rage") ''causes of fears'' Now I lay me -> (link-goto: "papers") down to sleep -> (link-goto: "hands") I pray the Moon -> (link-goto: "water falls") my soul I keep -> (link-goto: "doorlights") ''the enemy'' If I should die -> (link-goto: "Life sparks") before I wake, -> (link-goto: "First strike") I pray the Moon -> (link-goto: "HANDING DOWN DOOM") my soul to take. -> (link-goto: "1-2 punch") ''the ultimate air raid'' Hush a bye baby -> (link-goto: "DOWN TO GRIEF") on a moon beam, -> (link-goto: "intentions.") ''--Higher'' -> (link-goto: "For poorer") ''--Further'' -> (link-goto: "had left her") ''--Lower'' -> (link-goto: "ALL I REALLY WANT") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")To: Sarah Murphy From: Sarah Subject: Psych files DateLine: Fall 1989 Janet's birth was much easier than Laurel's had been. Janet politely signalled with even spaced pains, waited patiently for the ambulance, and made her appearance just under a half an hour after I was prepped. No complications there, and I brought her home quickly. The Catholic charity sent out ten girls in a row to help when Janet was born. They would stream into the house, carrying oversize suitcases of blowdryers, torn jeans, and oversize sweatshirts. They would stream back out of the house carrying earplugs and clutching rosaries. One lasted two hours. Another 5 minutes. After a while, the girls stopped coming. Janet and I learned to ''live around the sounds'' of Laurel's screams. --Higher --Further --Lower ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''live around the sounds'' Baby and I -> (link-goto: "Janet's essay") were baked in a pie. -> (link-goto: "Meds") The gravy was way too hot -> (link-goto: "Sandwiches") We had nothing to pay -> (link-goto: "babysitters") to the baker that day, -> (link-goto: "As the Grocery Turns") And so we crept out -> (link-goto: "Beyond anything") of her pot. -> (link-goto: "ok") ''--Higher'' -> (link-goto: "For poorer") ''--Further'' -> (link-goto: "I knew") ''--Lower'' -> (link-goto: "BONES KNOW") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")To: Sarah Murphy From: Sarah Subject: Psych files DateLine: Summer 1989 I tried everything I could to handle Laurel's screams. She had ''no words'', no other language to communicate her anguish. After she had cried nonstop for over a month, I made an appointment with Doctor Jacobsen, the pediatrician the insurance company recommended. I told the nurse I wanted to speak with the doctor over the phone first. She sounded a bit odd as we made the phone appointment, but Dr. Jacobsen called on the dot and did not flinch at the background of screams. He said to bring her ''in after hours*'' so no one else would be disturbed. I thanked him. When we got there, he took his time. Slowly Laurel accepted the stethoscope he had warmed in his hand. He listened for gas, for breathing, for heartbeats. Tested her reflexes. Felt for any tender areas. Held her carefully and told her that he was going to draw blood. Laurel never stopped her scaled screaming, but she never modulated into the ''tones of terror'' either. After making notes, we set up a phone appointment for the results. He called back, promptly on the dot with the news that nothing seemed to be out of place physically. We talked about the asymptomatic weeks that had led up to this sudden onset, the slow development beforehand. I had not realized that at fifteen months Laurel should have been able to speak a few words, understand and comply with complex directions like "turn off the tv" or "come into the living room." Laurel had done none of these things. She had seemed content to lie in her crib, staring at her iridescent mobile of the cow, the fork, and the spoon jumping over the moon. He asked if there had been anything emotional that might be causing this, any outside stress. I told him, there had been some marital difficulties, and actually my husband had left for good the week before this and probably wasn't coming back. He asked if this final breaking point was from the child's screaming. I said, no, there had been ''other issues'', too. He said there wasn't much he could do and recommended we both see a psychologist. Gave me some sleeping pills, and nodded when I said I couldn't take them - there was ''no one to watch'' Laurel while I slept. Gave Laurel some children's aspirin just on the off chance it might be physical. --Higher --Further --Lower ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''no words'' Words are the only -> (link-goto: "pre-verbal") power the soul has -> (link-goto: "books") over her world -> (link-goto: "Mama") ''in after hours*'' -> (link-goto: "in after hours") ''tones of terror'' On a scale that only -> (link-goto: "After I") the moon could understand -> (link-goto: "The storm") ''other issues'' No nothing spectacular -> (link-goto: "credit cards") Just the everyday -> (link-goto: "clean") terrors of life. -> (link-goto: "affair") ''no one to watch'' If it takes a village -> (link-goto: "Warning shot") to raise a child, what am -> (link-goto: "she asked") I doing in the suburbs? -> (link-goto: "Out on a limb") ''--Higher'' -> (link-goto: "For poorer") ''--Further'' ->(link-goto: "once,") ''--Lower'' -> (link-goto: "STONES UNDERSTAND") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")To: Sarah Murphy From: Sarah Subject: Psych files DateLine: Spring 1990 When I got back to town, I rushed over to the Oak Ridge Institute and demanded to see my daughter. I had to talk with her, if only to make reparations for my poor mothering behind glass, like a prisoner apologizing for her sins, touching the glass as if it were the fingers of the one she has murdered. I was led into a small cement waiting room, with a demarcation line painted firmly on the concrete - white on the top and a dark khaki underneath, as if this stark contrast was all that was needed to fend off the ill winds of feeblemindedness (or whatever terms they were using at the moment). I opened the door, waiting. A nurse in a white cap shuffled back over the yellowed linoleum tiles and brought out a limp bundle, wrapped tightly against the cold. She carried her bundle stiffly, arms outstretched, hands clawing in like the rails on a crib - there only to keep things from falling out of line. She placed the bundle on the seat beside me. I opened it slowly, lifting the face from the edges of the starched white sheets. A thin parody of Laurel's face lay in the depths of the cloth, her image smudged with silence, with tears. I could not tell if the tears were mine or hers. She opened her eyes, struggled to get her arms free of the sheets, and held onto my hand. Her arm clenched mine, her face still impassive, still unmoving. I held her. She struggled free, still silent. Walked over to the door and started to pound on it with her fists. I opened it. She walked out into the hallway, tugging at my arm in the way she always did to lead me to whatever it was she wanted. I followed. We went to the front desk, where she pounded her way along the railing. Over to the double front doors, which she pounded. I stopped her, showed her how they opened outwards. She stepped through and pounded the sidewalk. Dropped my hand, ran over to the car, and pounded on the passenger side. We left. I called later, explaining what had happened, and told them we would not require their services. Naturally, there was a lot more to it than that. This was the first of the many ''Social Service'' visits, explanations, and reports. But I don't want to get into that right now. --Higher --Lower ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''Social Service'' These people know that -> (link-goto: "Social Services") in loco parentis means -> (link-goto: "Gestapo") that parents are loco. -> (link-goto: "Leaving") ''--Higher'' -> (link-goto: "For poorer") ''--Lower'' -> (link-goto: "MOON MOTHER") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")To: Sarah Murphy From: Sarah Subject: Truth files Only the pale shadows of things survived outside of the words written in the moon's blood. Dimly, the shadows sensed that they were not what they had once been, and the shadows wrote their own words of a golden age which none of them could remember. The moon read their words and wept. Seeing the ''shadows' longing'', the moon tried to make things right. She erased part of a scroll, the one that talked of the ways people understood the universe, conversed with the stars, and kept faith with themselves and the animals. But as she erased the words, these things were not strong enough to reappear in the world, and so they fell out of existence altogether. The moon tried to breathe life into the words. But the words had lost the ability to breathe with her. They stared, lifeless, on the page. And the moon could not reach them in their ''tombs*''. --Go back --Press on ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''shadows' longing'' Q. What do shadows -> (link-goto: "SCATH GEALACH") want most? -> (link-goto: "MOON SHADOWS") A. To be-long. -> (link-goto: "moon cd") ''tombs*'' -> (link-goto: "Hecatomb") ''--Go back'' -> (link-goto: "AFTER THE FALL") ''--Press on'' -> (link-goto: "HIDING THE REAL") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")To: Sarah Murphy From: Sarah Subject: Psych files DateLine: Spring 1990 I put Laurel in the Oak Ridge Institute on a "trial basis." Dr. ''Graybill'' got around the waiting list by saying it was an emergency, temporary placement. We would find the way to pay the bills somehow. Dad said it was the best thing for all of us and presented me with a ''prepaid hotel stay*'' at the Red Mountain Inn in Glenwood Springs. Janet and I stayed for six glorious days. I called the Oak Ridge Institute twice a day, asking about Laurel. They said she was fine, that she was doing well, and had stopped screaming about thirteen hours after I left. They said she was eating. They said she was not making eye contact, but that would come in time. I took some of the time for myself. I had a shower that was over an hour long, treated myself to a hot oil treatment, an actual hair cut, and long sessions in the two olympic size pools of natural hot springs. As I lay in the hot water and looked up at the newly green mountains, I wondered if I should have done this a long time ago. After all, I told myself, the experts did in thirteen hours what you failed to do in thirteen months. Maybe I really am a bad influence on my daughter. Maybe I did cause this. I looked over each of my actions with a magnifying glass for the ''seed crystal'', the action I could hold up and say, this was the catalyst. This was the cause of the whole thing. Had she heard our whispered fights? Had I tried to toilet train her too soon? Given up too soon? Was it being pregnant with Janet? Had I rubbed my belly where she could see me? Breast fed her too long? Not long enough? Fed her the wrong breakfast cereal? My mind raced faster than the wind in the pine trees. The bubbles streaming up from the chair as I lay there did nothing to calm my nerves. --Higher --Further --Lower ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''Graybill'' -> (link-goto: "leave her again.") ''prepaid hotel stay*'' -> (link-goto: "prepaid") ''seed crystal'' Predestination. -> (link-goto: "You plan") When the moon thought -> (link-goto: "The final shot") she knew what -> (link-goto: "Bruno's legacy") she was doing. -> (link-goto: "Before the storm") ''--Higher'' -> (link-goto: "For poorer") ''--Further'' -> (link-goto: "leave her again.") ''--Lower'' -> (link-goto: "SCATH GEALACH") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")To: Sarah Murphy From: Sarah Subject: Psych files DateLine: Fall 1989 Dr. Jacobsen tried antibiotics, then taking her off all solid foods and rotating from one formula to another until we'd covered every brand on the market. He had me giving her enemas twice a week, until she turned up anemic. Nothing worked. At his insistence, we went to a psychiatrist, Dr. ''Graybill'', a sweet lady who each session first drank a full diet Doctor Pepper and then smoked four Virginia Slims, using the empty can as an ashtray. Laurel was fascinated by the way the ash settled into the rim of the can and would tip the can slightly to see how far the ash would move. At first, I tried to prevent this, but Dr. Graybill smiled and explained that she wanted to see how Laurel reacted on her own. I smiled back and relaxedÃ‘as much as we could. Laurel started with her frightened moaning but gradually relaxed into her scaled screaming. I rocked Janet and talked over the screams, telling her how lonely I'd been, how difficult it was to see anyone, how no one would stay to help and how I could not find ''the resources I needed'' to survive. She asked me how I was making it, and I said, one second at a time. She asked why I hadn't sought help, and I showed her the file. She asked why I hadn't simply let Laurel go into an institution where they could help and I told her Laurel needed me, that I hadn't seen ''an institution'' that could help. She asked me if I had ''looked very hard*''. We went for four sessions, each a month apart. At each session, I showed her the results of my searches, the societies, the doctors I had called, the bills I had not been able to pay. I told her I could not pay her bill, either, that we would have to work something out. On the fourth session, Dr. Graybill said she had the answers. All Laurel and I needed was a break from each other, she said. A short vacation for both of us would do ''wonders*''. I could sleep, catch up on my humanity. Laurel, freed from my grasp, could become normal. And she had found the very place. Oak Ridge Institute would take Laurel on a trial basis, just so we could have the breathing space we needed. I was too tired to do anything but agree. --Higher --Further --Lower ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''Graybill'' -> (link-goto: "I could never") ''the resources I needed'' Hey, no, nobody home. -> (link-goto: "messed up financially") Meat, nor drink -> (link-goto: "Try outs") nor money -> (link-goto: "locate resources") have I none. -> (link-goto: "The great wall") Hey no, nobody home. -> (link-goto: "Resources") ''an institution'' Institutionarianism. -> (link-goto: "Unsafe") When you die, -> (link-goto: "Isolation") someone judges that -> (link-goto: "Implement") your soul cannot survive -> (link-goto: "Leaving") on its own. -> (link-goto: "Smokers") So your sould is locked up -> (link-goto: "Withering choices") for its own good -> (link-goto: "On an orphan train") ''looked very hard*'' -> (link-goto: "looked very hard") ''wonders*'' -> (link-goto: "wonders") ''--Higher'' -> (link-goto: "For poorer") ''--Futher'' -> (link-goto: "I could never") ''--Lower'' -> (link-goto: "SCATH GEALACH") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")NOTE: This is Laurel's recipe: In a medium bowl, stir in two cups of water, three tablespoons cornstarch, and a quarter cup Dawn dishwashing detergent. Swirl gently. Dip hands in and blow. Catch the sunlight if you can. Keep trying if you cannot. Eat the Sunlight when you have it. I am not sure if it is lunch or bubbles. She eats it anyway. And seems fine for the moment. I join her. The soap ''sunlight'' is almost tangy, almost a darkened silver. --back ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''sunlight'' Daffy-down-dilly -> (link-goto: "Leaving") in her yellow petticoat -> (link-goto: "After the child") and her green gown. -> (link-goto: "MOON SHADOWS") ''--back'' --DELETE-- -> (link-goto: "eccentric lunch") back -> (link-goto: "And rejoice") back -> (link-goto: "For poorer") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes") All I really want is one silent moment. Then I would tell my Laurel I love her. In spite of or because of everything. But the moon in all her wisdom gets in the way, somehow. --Moon --Sarah ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''I love her'' Love is... -> (link-goto: "dramatical") knowing that my world -> (link-goto: "LULLABY") is only complete -> (link-goto: "On second thought") when you are with me. -> (link-goto: "Rain included") ''--Moon'' -> (link-goto: "NO TURNING BACK") ''--Sarah'' -> (link-goto: "Emergency") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes") Moonstones know they are the moon's ''shattered bones''. They know what the moon has forgotten to tell even herself. They know that I whisper in Laurel's ear she is my sweet moonchild. They know that sometimes I tiptoe over to Laurel and lay my head next to hers on the pillow, listening for her breath. How long will it take, I wonder, for them to call the moon back and tell her where her moonchild is? I shudder at my thoughts. At night I lie awake, too exhausted for sleep. I watch the moon as she steals back across my bedroom window. --Moon --Sarah ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''shattered bones'' Love is... -> (link-goto: "bones") Pulling the pieces -> (link-goto: "BONES KNOW") out of the dust. -> (link-goto: "Broken wires") ''--Moon'' -> (link-goto: "NO TURNING BACK") ''--Sarah'' -> (link-goto: "Emergency") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")NOTE: This was the first time that someone had asked me to take Laurel in when no one else would be around. It was far from the last. I speculated on the motives behind this: * Good policy--it is easier on Laurel when no one is around and the doctor can see her in more "normal" circumstances. * Good timing--Laurel can take up far more time than a normal child, so seeing her at the end of the day will not make everyone else wait. * Good business--who would want to go to a doctor who has screaming, uncured children in his waiting room? All the same, in the back of my mind, I keep thinking about segregation. Do we have ''unofficial'' ''Jim Crow laws'' for the disabled? --back ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''unofficial '' Does the saying: -> (link-goto: "Sidestreaming") "Out of sight, -> (link-goto: "On an orphan train") Out of mind" -> (link-goto: "Yanking") have more than -> (link-goto: "show and tell") ''Jim Crow laws'' Does the saying: -> (link-goto: "Sidestreaming") "Out of sight, -> (link-goto: "On an orphan train") Out of mind" -> (link-goto: "Yanking") have more than -> (link-goto: "show and tell") one meaning? -> (link-goto: "I knew") ''--back'' back -> (link-goto: "had left her") back -> (link-goto: "Two camps") back -> (link-goto: "Brown vs. Board") back -> (link-goto: "sidestream") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes") Bones know. You press everything inside them until the weight devours all the ''secret places''. You know then there are no more calcium crannies to hide what you cannot face. The bones cannot hold your atoms in place any longer, and they shatter under the weight of what you have never said. Their shards pick at your skin late at night, saying we knew. We knew. --Moon --Sarah ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''secret places'' Love is... -> (link-goto: "Dedication") Making sure -> (link-goto: "any place") that hiding places are -> (link-goto: "carpet knows") plentiful and safe. -> (link-goto: "hideouts") ''--Moon'' -> (link-goto: "No turning back") ''--Sarah'' -> (link-goto: "Emergency") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")NOTE: Actually, I am not sure that these are her words. Perhaps they come from another ''layer of memory'', another form of my own subconscious. --back ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''layer of memory'' There is rosemary, -> (link-goto: "The air") that is for remembrance. -> (link-goto: "GLASS HARMONICA") Pray you love, remember -> (link-goto: "HYSTERICS") ''--back'' -> (link-goto: "I knew") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")But the memory of my sweet Laurel was locked too carefully within the moon's bones. Slowly, the ''arthritic memory'' stole over her bones, wakening in the cold fog air. Her calcium caves remembered my Laurel dancing in her green and yellows . This vision turns the moon inward, cell by cell, like sap stealing out of the aspen, coloring the hills with my memories. --Moon --Sarah ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''arthritic memory'' Love is... -> (link-goto: "a cyst") remembering everything -> (link-goto: "ARKENSTONES") without remorse. -> (link-goto: "moon mind") ''--Moon'' -> (link-goto: "NO TURNING BACK") ''--Sarah'' -> (link-goto: "Emergency") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")NOTE: They all thought I was crazy, but I finally convinced all doctors Laurel had seen to join in one conference call. At long last, we could talk about Laurel, and not Laurel's behavior separate from Laurel's digestion separate from Laurel's tactile sense separate from Laurel's neurons separate from Laurel's left big toe. Or so I thought. I hoped we might come up with some novel way of thinking about Laurel. Dr. Jacobsen finally suggested, "Perhaps Laurel is ''not really in pain''. Perhaps she ''merely perceives*'' that she is in pain." Well. ''Isn't that novel''? --back ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''not really in pain'' Pain is of the mind. -> (link-goto: "WARNING LIGHTS") The mind does not -> (link-goto: "to become") acknowledge pain. -> (link-goto: "Show biz") ''merely perceives*'' -> (link-goto: "merely perceives") ''Isn't that novel'' Knock, knock. -> (link-goto: "Have it your way") Who's there? -> (link-goto: "Damned if you do") Olga -> (link-goto: "Wrong residence") Olga who? -> (link-goto: "Catch 22") Olga crazy if I have -> (link-goto: "Flea training") to think this way -> (link-goto: "Can't say I") ''--back'' back -> (link-goto: "I knew") back -> (link-goto: "Profession") back -> (link-goto: "Egress") -> (link-goto: "URL") -> (link-goto: "so far") back -> (link-goto: "URL") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")NOTE: I told ''Dad'' that I would really rather have the money to pay the bills. He said that this was better for my health and sanity in the long run and not to worry about it. I said that my health would be better if I didn't have to worry about the collection agency. He said it was this or nothing. I took it. --back ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''Dad'' Stubbornness runs -> (link-goto: "After the knowing") in the family. -> (link-goto: "Cop-sickles") ''--back'' back -> (link-goto: "I could never") back -> (link-goto: "After the knowing") back -> (link-goto: "When you knew") back -> (link-goto: "MOON CAKES") back -> (link-goto: "Cast of characters") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")The harvest moon hangs low, gravid, almost below the horizon. The night air is too still to hear the crickets. We stand, hands tight against the rail on the deck, just staring at her, waiting for clouds to cover her. You can feel ''her children'' from here, I whisper to Laurel. We know them. The deep red fullness of the moon's body clings to me. Why can't the moon ''find her own children'', I wonder. Sometimes she seems ready to burst with child. Or is it then that I wake up, knowing her moon child has lost its way and found me? --Moon --Sarah ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''her children'' Nothing is free from -> (link-goto: "MOON GIRL") the darkened moon. -> (link-goto: "MOON SHADOWS") ''find her own children'' Love is... -> (link-goto: "MOON GIRL") Knowing when to -> (link-goto: "MOON PRINCESS") hold on tight -> (link-goto: "MOON MOTHER") and never let go. -> (link-goto: "MOON FALLEN") ''--Moon'' -> (link-goto: "NO TURNING BACK") ''--Sarah'' -> (link-goto: "Emergency") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")Old Moon, I need to tell you. You have twisted the ancient legends so ''far from the truth'' that we can no longer recognize our creator. You, with your endlessly changing faces, your silvering but never aging body, are the mother to the fates. Virgin, mother, crone all spin their entrails and cut their threads from your template. I understand this. I see you so clearly, the full eye between clouds that change from laughing lights to burning dragons in a heart's moment. Now that I have divined ''your secret'', I can only ask once again, knowing this time you will hear me: Give her back. --Moon --Sarah ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''from the truth'' Love is... -> (link-goto: "Underlying truth") knowing when -> (link-goto: "MOON STORIES") the truth will -> (link-goto: "MOONBLOOD") set you free -> (link-goto: "DEATH WAITS FOR LIFE") ''your secret'' When you write -> (link-goto: "desire rises up") your secrets in blood, -> (link-goto: "moon closets") expect them to -> (link-goto: "BESTOWING BIRTHRIGHTS") wash away. -> (link-goto: "leaving only") ''--Moon'' -> (link-goto: "NO TURNING BACK") ''--Sarah'' -> (link-goto: "Emergency") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes") NOTE: The looks always mean something like "I would never let my daughter out in that condition" (as if the autism or the bare feet or the tousled hair and torn, stained dress were catching). Or "Well, it is obvious she got what she deserved" (as if this could not happen to anyone decent, to anyone they know, or god forbid, to them.) Or, worse yet "We are ''throwing away'' our scant resources on her?" This one is hard to answer. Yes, you don't have enough money. No, Laurel is a human being and deserves as much an education as your children. But as the looks are silent, so are my replies. --back ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''throwing away'' How easy is it -> (link-goto: "attention") to throw away a life? -> (link-goto: "Time costs") ''--back'' back -> (link-goto: "Life in the good lane") back -> (link-goto: "environments") back -> (link-goto: "Can I help?") back -> (link-goto: "Bruno") back -> (link-goto: "Mama") back -> (link-goto: "Not working") back -> (link-goto: "being paranoid") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes") NOTE: Obsessive Compulsive Disorder Insisting on rituals or repetitive actions - a common sidekick to autism. --back ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''rituals'' We have communicated -> (link-goto: "practice") in rituals from -> (link-goto: "RITUALS") the beginning of time. -> (link-goto: "REPETITION") ''--back'' back -> (link-goto: "Not working") back -> (link-goto: "Flyer") back -> (link-goto: "Credits") back -> (link-goto: "Profits at home") back -> (link-goto: "Thursday coffees") back -> (link-goto: "Random mixup") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")To: mmarconi@netcom.com, grahambell@aol.com, grever@ibr8smtp... From: Sarah Subject: Retreats Date: 12/22/96 24:26 Hello again. This is definitely one of those times when I hope that this message finds you in much better shape than it left me. Hope your holiday preparations are going well, festivities and joyous celebrations planned and executed with all deliberate joy and goodwill of the season. As for this home front, things are a bit warped. I think we will put off celebrating anything for a while, and wait until Laurel calms down a wee bit. Laurel has been moody all day (?) all week! all month! ''Winter break*'' confuses Laurel - she has dressed herself, grabbed her books, and stood waiting for the bus every day this week. She will wait on the corner for as long as I let her and then pushes away as I lead her inside. Stomping her foot and shaking her whole body, she will retreat to a corner and mutter. I explained that this was Winter break, that it was temporary and she would be going back to school soon. Janet tried to play school with her, going over the workbooks and giving out starbursts for just being there. I dragged out the materials we had had so much luck with this summer and tried to get Laurel interested in putting the banana card over the banana, the walrus card over the stuffed walrus. None of this worked. Laurel just put her hands over her ears and hummed at us. Even the muppets have lost their appeal. This morning, I tried one more time to get her interested in ''her comm book''. I took out the paper and cut out icons (a Christmas tree and a ''pine wreath'') that I thought she might like. Something new, something different. This was, of course, a massive mistake. When I put the icons on the "This is what is going to happen now" page, Laurel freaked. Her eyes grew big, her mouth puckered in on itself, and she started to rock. Needless to say, we did not go out for a tree. Janet had already brought out the ornaments, and Laurel took each ornament and carefully smashed it against the window. I tried to stop her, holding her in my arms and pressing against her belly. She wriggled free and started her keening screaming. I tried to tie her down, but she struggled too hard for me to get a good grip and leave a hand free to restrain her. Janet grabbed the comm book and shoved it at Laurel. With her hand covered in ''blood and glass shards'', Laurel grabbed the comm book from my hands and started tearing it. Blood covered every bit of the pages. When she found she could not tear the fabric and velcro of the book itself, she pushed me aside, wrenched open my desk, and pulled out the scissors. Her hands were still full of glass shards, but she stabbed the book with the scissors until nothing was left but rags. Then she ran into her room and locked the door. I could still hear her wailing hours later, her hands still pounding on the door. I stayed on the other side of the door for those hours, slumped over. There was nothing else I could do. She came out about a half hour ago. The skin on her hands was shredded, and there were several long bruises on her arm. But the blood had dried. We took a shower together and I cleaned up as much of the wounds as I could. I thought about going in to the emergency room, but I don't think either of us can handle that at this point. --Higher --lower ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''Winter break*'' -> (link-goto: "Winter break") ''her comm book'' Q. What are invisible -> (link-goto: "Into our own hands") yet rule the world? -> (link-goto: "Real words") A. Words. -> (link-goto: "FLOOD OF WORDS") ''pine wreath'' The most terrifying -> (link-goto: "pine secrets") things are those that -> (link-goto: "papers") surround us every day. -> (link-goto: "doors") ''blood and glass shards'' We use blood and glass -> (link-goto: "Just another day") to stitch our souls -> (link-goto: "blood talks") back together. -> (link-goto: "PRAYERS UNANSWERED") ''--Higher'' -> (link-goto: "Not working") ''--Lower'' -> (link-goto: "Glimpses") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")NOTE: The politically correct term for the Christmas holidays. Heaven forfend we should mention any ''religious mumbo-jumbo'' in connection with our schools, so we call it Winter break - as if it were winter itself we were trying to break. --back ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''religious mumbo-jumbo'' Once, merely living -> (link-goto: "free her.") through each day was -> (link-goto: "PRAYERS UNANSWERED") religion in itself -> (link-goto: "LULLABY") ''--back'' back -> (link-goto: "Broken wires") back -> (link-goto: "Bible stack") back -> (link-goto: "OTHER list") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes") To: mmarconi@netcom.com, grahambell@aol.com, grever@ibr8smtp... From: Sarah Date: 12/28/96 Subject: Walking a mile in the other guy's army boots Reading a really depressing book right now, which just about fits my mood. I've actually been reading it for the past month or so. When I can. I picked it up because of the title, Children with Emerald Eyes: Histories of Extraordinary Boys and Girls. I would like to think that Laurel is not alone, that the emerald green of her eyes means something to someone. Any way, before I get too awfully maudlin, I wanted to show you what I found on page 197. The author has spent the time up till now teaching autistic and developmentally disabled kids, and has just taken one, Danny, home for a month. Here is her report back: "Then I learned to have respect for the parents of such children. To live with these kids is at times beyond the ''realm of imagination''. It is at times a test of human endurance. And at times a ripping of one's guts, a tearing of one's frazzled nerves. It was then that I learned, at least a tiny bit, what the parents of these children go through. It was then I learned what it means ''not to have a life'' of one's own. It was then that I learned some compassion for parents. It was then that I learned some humility. And for that I shall always be grateful to Danny and his parents." (page 197) See?? Someone understands at least a little. But only because she had to care for Danny (an autistic boyÃ‘or rather "a whirly fleeting thing that was a boy" (p. 158)). She had only a month of this never-ending-life-sucking mania, and she wrote that. Cool. Wonder what I would write if I could have time to write. Because I am such a nice person (and I may want to find this book again: it is a library book and I wouldn't mind it being on my shelf, hint, hint) here is the other info you might need: Mira Rothenberg, 1960, 1977 The Dial Press, New York. 1 Dag Hammerskold Plaza New York, NY 10017 --Higher --Lower ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''realm of imagination'' There is something more -> (link-goto: "if you understand") terrible than dragons -> (link-goto: "Slipping") at the outer edges -> (link-goto: "THE SOUL SELECTS") of old maps. -> (link-goto: "Doubletake") ''not to have a life'' someone could make -> (link-goto: "I") a fortune renting -> (link-goto: "Any other questions?") out old lives. -> (link-goto: "Out on a limb") ''--Higher ''-> (link-goto: "Broken wires") ''--Lower'' -> (link-goto: "Herculean") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")To: Sarah Murphy From: Sarah Subject: Unanswered Files Dateline: Too tired to care Towering in the sink are bowls and more bowls crusted with oatmeal, pea soup, spaghetti-o's. Papers for Laurel's IEP, her meds, her therapy litter the floor. Bills spill over from my desk onto old dog droppings Laurel brought in from somewhere. I would scream but then Laurel would join in and we would never stop. I cannot remember how Hercules cleaned the Aegean stables. I seem to recall something about a maiden crooning to him, singing while floods cleared the stench of a thousand years. He has a nice relaxing day, wakes up refreshed, and claims his reward. I want ''someone to croon'' for me. I cannot croon for myself. --Higher --Lower ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''someone to croon'' Where is -> (link-goto: "Forget-me-nots") Frank Sinatra -> (link-goto: "He declines") when you need him -> (link-goto: "affair") ''--Higher'' -> (link-goto: "Glimpses") ''--Lower'' -> (link-goto: "Ach du lieber") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")To: mmarconi@netcom.com, grahambell@aol.com, grever@ibr8smtp... From: Sarah Date: 12/25/96 Subject: Merry Christmas My mattress smells like dog barf. I want a double bed, with a frame, and bedding... ''Laurel's hand'' is infected. I haven't had my hair done in over a year and it looks it. The world is a shitty place. And my kitchen is the epicenter of cruddiness. There are moldy spaghetti stains on the wallpaper. Really. I have an attitude problem. I wish I could just go to sleep and wake up to something else. Waa. Poor me. : *< --Higher --Lower ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''Laurel's hand'' This has happened -> (link-goto: "Broken wires") more than once. -> (link-goto: "glass") attitude problem -> ? ''--Higher'' -> (link-goto: "Herculean") ''--Lower'' -> (link-goto: "Rituals") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")These are the tributes the moon requires. She bends the tides into her majestic dances, so slow and so large that she alone can fathom their complexity. She commands ''the blood'' in our bodies, figuring each corpuscle into its own quadrille. Fashioning our breath into her being, she shapes each action, requires each reaction. Thus are we powerless before her. Thus we go out as we came in. This is the terror in the necronomicons, this the hidden horror under the instructions to turn three times in the moonlight and say our Ave Marias and ''paternosters'' backwards. --Moon --Sarah ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''the blood'' I will drain my heart -> (link-goto: "AFTER A WHILE") to the dregs for my child -> (link-goto: "moon flesh") ''paternosters'' do not leave us. -> (link-goto: "Meaning what") who art in heaven, -> (link-goto: "Cop-sickles") Our father, -> (link-goto: "The father") ''--Moon'' -> (link-goto: "NO TURNING BACK") ''--Sarah'' -> (link-goto: "For poorer") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")NOTE: Perhaps he merely perceives that I will pay him. --back ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''--back'' back -> (link-goto: "looked very hard.") back -> (link-goto: "Egress") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")To: Sarah Murphy From: Sarah Subject: Truth files Nothing would hold the words of the moon but the moon herself. She tore open her skin and dribbled her hands into her flesh. She drew the ink from ''her own blood'', still heavy from giving birth to the entire universe. She made her pen from ''her own hair'', long and silver strands that rested on the sea, billowing with the breath of the waves. The parchment she stretched from her ''own fair skin'', sacrificing swaths of her thin covering, revealing the bone-white stones beneath. Thus she made ready to write. --goback --presson ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''her own blood'' Blood is what carries -> (link-goto: "AFTER A WHILE") our souls. -> (link-goto: "blood talks") ''her own hair'' Hair is what carries -> (link-goto: "hair") our thoughts down -> (link-goto: "Can I help?") to our souls. -> (link-goto: "Doubletake") ''own fair skin'' Skin is a thin -> (link-goto: "moon skin") boundary between -> (link-goto: "moon flesh") us and reality. -> (link-goto: "so far") ''--go back'' -> (link-goto: "IT MUST BE WRITTEN") ''--press on'' -> (link-goto: "FLOOD OF WORDS") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")To: mmarconi@netcom.com, grahambell@aol.com, grever@ibr8smtp... From: Sarah Date: 7/16/96 22:19 Subject: Water in the desert LIke Helen, we wish to announce an epiphany. This has been an incredible summer, but once more, Houston, we have ''contact!'' We have lift off! Lemme explain. Last night, I went to a Facilitated Communication Workshop put on by the Colorado Chapter of the Autism Society of America. When I got home, I told Laurel I'd found a great way for us to communicate. I would learn to help her and we'd be able to talk to each other. She could ask me questions and tell me what she wanted. She immediately began to make more direct eye contact, smile, and respond to my voice. She hummed loudly and began to rock with my hand. I got her desk and chair and put a photocopy of an IntelliType keyboard in front of her. I said, (text-colour:navy)["Come here and sit down."] And she came right over and sat by me, her hand searching for mine again. I asked her to find (text-colour:navy)["A,"] holding my right hand over hers to isolate her index finger. Laurel pushed the power button several times, but I told her it was just a ''paper copy'' and if this worked we would get a real one. I said again, (text-colour:navy)["Find A."] Her finger hovered gently over the left of the center row (where A would be on a computer keyboard). Janet was hovering too, wanting to get in on this new type of game. (text-colour:red)["You're so slow Laurel,"] she said and grabbed Laurel's hand, dragging it over to the (text-colour:red)["A."] After a short break, I asked Laurel to spell her name. She pushed "L." I praised her and put an orange starburst on the keyboard by L. She typed (text-colour:green)["LA" "LA" "LA"] and vocalized (text-colour:green)["LO, LO, LO"] (which when you say the first sylable of her name makes a certain amount of sense. I wonder what she makes of phonics!). Then, wonder of wonders, she smiled and looked at me. I said, (text-colour:navy)["Okay, now 'U.'"] and she pressed "UR" and said, "LOR." After about a minute, she pressed "LLLLLLLLLLL" and sang, quite clearly, "Peanut, peanut butter." She pushed back the desk and ran over to the refrigerator. She said, "wa, wah," and then said "peh, peh." I got out the Pepsi, but she really wanted a grape popsicle. She flopped on the couch as if exhausted, and Janet went to croon over her. But Laurel kept returning to the desk and her paper. She pressed "L" and several other letters. I facilitated. She left after a few minutes and I did not pursue it. Before bed that evening, Laurel had ''said more'' than she had said all summer: "dog," "I want," "shower," and even "good." (she had never before attempted "good" needless to say, I was thrilled). She made unusually direct and frequent eye contact and appeared happy and excited. She even "ahhhed" along when Janet sang "Somewhere Out There" at bedtime. A good night was had by all. --Higher --Lower ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''contact!'' Q. How do cabinets -> (link-goto: "Into our own hands") communicate? -> (link-goto: "Real words") A. With contact paper. -> (link-goto: "Mama") ''paper copy'' Q. What paths do -> (link-goto: "papers") bookworms leave? -> (link-goto: "letters come") A. Paper trails. -> (link-goto: "shut downs") ''said more'' Why is what you -> (link-goto: "Can't say 1") say more important than -> (link-goto: "Can't say 2") what you mean? -> (link-goto: "pre-verbal") ''--Higher'' -> (link-goto: "For richer") ''--Lower'' -> (link-goto: "Real words") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes") To: mmarconi@netcom.com, grahambell@aol.com, grever@ibr8smtp... From: Sarah Date: 9/8/96 23:17 Subject: When did you know? Somebody on the autism list asked the subject question. One mother remembered thinking, "If I just love her more, she'll love me back." Here's a copy of my answer. Laurel was born in June 1987, a couple of months after Psychology Today had this big anniversary issue covering the life cycle. It stated that a baby only a few days old would imitate facial expressions. So when I brought Laurel home from the hospital, I made faces at her. She'd smile and giggle but never made any attempt to imitate me. I thought this was odd. I mentioned it to a doctor, who sarcastically said, "Well, I would believe everything you read in Psychology Today." Laurel was so terrified of the blow dryer and vacuum cleaner noises that I didn't use them at all; I put thrift store sheets down on the floor, gathered and washed them when they got dirty. She could work the VCR and stereo independently since she was able to crawl. She didn't like the music I selected (Beethoven, classic rock) but kept tuning in a country station which I hate! At one year, Laurel was playing peek-a-boo with everything like she invented the game. She never spoke, but she would stay up for hourse in the night, playing ''peek-a-boo with the moon''. But she didn't reach to be picked up, ''speak*'' any words clearly, point or wave, and she had no discernible word for "''mama.''" I remember commenting to someone that babies were said to be loving, but really, at that age, they just saw parents as tools to deliver food and warmth and entertainment. Children just develop at different rates, my pediatrician said. At seven months, Laurel was riding on my shoulders and accidentally scratched my eye. Tthe opthalmologist flipped a console switch that lit up a toy monkey in the corner. This was supposed to keep her occupied and quiet while he looked at my eye. The monkey chittered and banged cymbals. Laurel didn't look. The doctor switched the monkey off and on again. Laurel looked at the switch. The doctor did not say anything, but I could hear him thinking that something was not right with this child. Laurel was ''"kicked out" of day care'' when she was 26 months old. One day, she simply started screaming. And didn't stop screaming for about two years. We went to Dr. Jacobsen, who at first put it down to colic, then said it couldn't be that bad. Then he sent me to a psychiatrist, Dr. Graybill, who convinced me to put Laurel away for a week at Oak Ridge Institute, just to get "Mom's" head in the right space. Obviously, the problem was a faulty mother/child bonding and ''going away'' would simply fix the problem. I was so desperate for anything that I did this. I came back nine days later to a silent stranger. And I walked out of there with her in my arms. Surely anything I did was better than sucking the soul out of her. This was a disaster. But seeing Laurel crushed that way gave me the strength to stand the noise. We got used to it and called it normal. I could not get a job, nor leave the house. I got back together with Laurel's father, and things were semi-ok for about two days. About nine months later, Laurel's sister Janet was born. Not only did Laurel keep on screaming, but she refused to change any of her ways. Laurel simply didn't recognize Janet in any way, shape, or form. I mean, Janet might as well have been a shoe. She didn't step on her, but neither did she acknowledge the baby in any way. (text-colour:red)["Sibling rivalry, of course,"] my friends said. (text-colour:navy)["Yeah, just like marriage is necrophilia,"] I said. They didn't get the joke. If there was one. I took Laurel to pediatricians, audiologists, neurologists, psychologists, etc. The audiologist said that results were inconclusive. Three pediatricians said, Wait and see. The neurologist said it was a worried mother syndrom and suggested I see a psychiatrist. Psychiatrists ranged from schizophrenic to severly retarded (and their diagnoses went with them)--Badump. Ching. I arranged for Laurel to be in an extraordinary day care led by the wife of the principal of the demonstration school (the public school that tries out new curriculum and teaching techniques). Laurel simply didn't see the adults or other kids. She might hold onto someone as she maneuvered the step into the back yard, but it was as if they were objects and not people. While the other children colored or listened to stories, Laurel played with the dishwasher and the vertical blinds. When I came to pick her up, she never heard me. I would call for her at the door and continue calling for her as I walked through the house, until I was standing right next to her. Eventually, she would look up, and her face would fill with joy. Yet at home, she would come running in from the bedroom when the opening music of her favorite video played ever so softly. And when I hummed to her, she'd match my tone. I took her to an audiologist. She was diagnosed, "not deaf." Wait and see. I took her to a pediatric neurologist. Laurel was again diagnosed "not deaf. Does not play appropriately with toys." But I couldn't find work and the divorce played havoc with our finances. When Laurel was three and a half, I made an appointment with the Children's Hospital's speech and language lab for evaluation. My Dad said, "Fine, do it your way," rolled his eyes. This is my ''Dad's way of saying'' that whatever I am doing is idiotic and any fool can see that. So I said, "No. If you've got something to say to me, say it." He told me that Laurel was not just delayed in speech; the way she related to people, the way she played, even the way she looked at things were different. I called Children's Hospital and asked for a more complete evaluation. After two weeks of testing (optical, audio, OT, PT, SLP, psych workups, genetics, fragile X, blood, urine, I don't know what all), Dr. ''Mollie O'Malley'' (doesn't that sound like a Dr. Seuss character?) sat across a table from me and, with eyes moist with concern, somber face and halting voice said, "Did you ever think it might be. . . autism?" I was in shock. Dr. Malley recommended I see Dr. Kathleen Frawley for a second opinion. So a few days later, we went to see Dr. Frawley. Laurel didn't want to draw dots and circles. She wanted the necklace on Kathleen's neck, and she grabbed for them nearly choking the good doctor. Kathleen silently handed over the string of bright yellow beads, and Laurel lowered them slowly up and down, just at the edge of her vision. Kathleen said, "Yep, she's autistic." And she might as well have been saying, "She's two" or "She has brown eyes." And that quickly, I realized that autism was just a word; it meant what I believed it meant. Life-consuming tragedy or just another trait and Laurel was still the same sweet, beautiful little girl she was before I'd ever heard that word. --higher --lower ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''peek-a-boo with the moon'' I knew before this. -> (link-goto: "peanut butter") I think I knew -> (link-goto: "MOON MADNESS") before I was born. -> (link-goto: "say nothing") ''speak*'' -> (link-goto: "pre-verbal") ''mama.'' When Laurel speaks, -> (link-goto: "Anthropophobia") the wind steals her voice -> (link-goto: "Flyer") I'm never sure I hear her -> (link-goto: "Mama") ''"kicked out" of day care'' Does Laurel know -> (link-goto: "The storm") she failed at -> (link-goto: "leave her again") the earliest age possible -> (link-goto: "regular classroom") ''going away'' Q. What is the difference -> (link-goto: "Not working") between jeans and sleep? -> (link-goto: "Bruno") A. Levi is in our jeans -> (link-goto: "I knew") and leaving is only -> (link-goto: "leave her again") in our dreams. -> (link-goto: "Leaving") ''marrige is necrophilia'' Q. Why do people laugh -> (link-goto: "Before the storm") in taverns? -> (link-goto: "Escaping the storm") A. It's an inn joke. -> (link-goto: "any place ") ''Dad's way of saying'' Knock, knock. -> (link-goto: "Dead parakeets") Who's there? -> (link-goto: "Meaning what") Father. -> (link-goto: "prepaid") Father who? -> (link-goto: "painted") The more you know ->(link-goto: "Patriarchy") the father you go. -> (link-goto: "Take me for a ride") ''Mollie O'Malley'' -> (link-goto: "Mama") ''--Higher'' -> (link-goto: "For richer") ''--Lower'' -> (link-goto: "Mama") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes") NOTE: Whatever did people do before computers made it possible to erase all of ''our mistakes''? --back ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''our mistakes'' Q. What do computers -> (link-goto: "I could never") eat for dinner? -> (link-goto: "desire rises up") A. Mis-steaks. -> (link-goto: "So he knows") --DELETE-- -> (link-goto: "Bruno deconstructed") ''--back'' back -> (link-goto: "Real words") back -> (link-goto: "Psychic Roses") back -> (link-goto: "MOON MADNESS") back -> (link-goto: "Helpfulness") ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]'' -> (link-goto: "Undercoverings") ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]'' -> (link-goto: "Selene's dreams") ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' -> (link-goto: "Cat's eyes")To: mmarconi@netcom.com, grahambell@aol.com, grever@ibr8smtp... From: Sarah Date: 7/31/96 24:39 Subject: Manna on the ground Chris and I have been working nonstop with Laurel--almost around the clock. Like a chimerical butterfly, she goes from comm book to facilitated typing sessions to workbook to calm walks to the gas station. This has been the most ''fantastic summer'' I have ever had. I got the Intellitype facilitated communication keyboard and program and hooked it into my Mac, and we have been using it every day. At first, Laurel was upset when she made a mistake (either in typing or capping or spacing. Everything had to be perfect, and if she hit the wrong key, then she would howl and keen and rush off to bang her head against the refrigerator. We never got an entire word out. Finally, today, Chris played facilitated typing with Janet, and Janet (having been coached very carefully ahead of time) made several mistakes. Each time Janet made a mistake, she said "ok, hit delete, hit delete" and would make a BIG deal of going over to the ''delete*'' key, with Chris' hand supporting her finger. Laurel watched this from the kitchen out of the corner of her eye, wary of these people who were in her space, taking up her talking board. Then she rocked very carefully and deliberately, holding Chris' hand and pressing nonexistent keys on the refrigerator. After Chris got her a grape popsicle, Laurel put the popsicle on top of the monitor and grabbed Chris' hand. They started to type. I didn't even dare to rescue the monitor from sure stickiness. Laurel typed in "i" then hit the delete key and held down the cap lock for "I" then released the cap lock and typed in "lov3e". Went back and erased the "3" and the "e," made it "love" and went on for the "you." When she had this, she tried to take up the grape popsicle (but this had melted into the computer long before). She howled. I gave her a new popsicle, and she touched the back of my hand, blowing into my face. Chris stood back and watched. The tears in all our faces were just ''too much to bear''. So we put the swing icon on the "This is what is going to happen now" page in Laurel's comm book and went out into the sunshine. --Higher --Lower ___________________ ''(text-colour:navy)[Sarah]''/ ''(text-colour:red)[Moon]''/ ''(text-colour:green)[Laurel]'' ___________________ Links: ____________________ ''fantastic summer'' Q. What do unicorns, -> (link-goto: "Doubletake") griffins, and depression -> (link-goto: "Life in the good lane") have in common? -> (link-goto: "Merging") A. They are all -> (link-goto: "Bake sale") mythical beasts. -> (link-goto: "god's eyes") ''delete*'' -> (link-goto: "delete keys") ''too much to bear'' Love is what gives us -> (link-goto: "Profoundly simple") strength when we have -> (link-goto: "Before the child") nothing left. -> (link-goto: "LISTEN") ''--Higher'' -> (link-goto: "Hands on talking") ''--Lower'' -> (link-goto: "School success!")
